div1.head: Military Orders for Robert P. Cooke, June 29, 1900
div1.p: Cooke

ORDERS, BOOKS, BLANKS & D.C. DIV.
A. G. O.
RECD. JUL 5 1900

THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Vol 175 A 1900

SPECIAL ORDERS, }
No. 99. }

HEADQUARTERS DIVISION OF CUBA,
Havana, June 29, 1900.

1. Acting Assistant Surgeon Robert P. Cooke, U. S. Army,
having reported at these Headquarters in compliance with
paragraph 15, Special Orders No. 135, current series, Head-
quarters of the Army, will proceed to Quemados, Cuba, and
report to the Commanding General, Department of Havana
and Pinar del Rio, for assignment to duty.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

2. Leave of absence for two (2) months, with permission
to leave the limits of the Division, is hereby granted Cap-
tain Eli A. Helmick, 10th Infantry.

3. Hospital Steward Clark L. Brown, U. S. Army, is re-
lieved from duty at the Medical Supply Depot, Havana,
Cuba, and will proceed to Quemados, Cuba, reporting upon
arrival to the Chief Surgeon, Department of Havana and
Pinar del Rio, for assignment to duty.

The Quartermaster's Department will furnish the neces-
sary transportation.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

4. The Quartermaster's Department will furnish the
necessary transportation from this city to San Francisco,
California, for Commissary Sergeant Jackson S. Britt, U. S.
Army, en route to Manila, Philippine Islands, per para-
graph 9, Special Orders No. 126, current series, Headquar-
ters of the Army.

The Subsistence Department will commute his rations, in
advance, at the prescribed rate, for the required number of
days involved in the land travel, and also during the num-
ber of days he is delayed in this city awaiting the departure
of a steamer, it having been and being impracticable to
provide for his subsistence in any other way, or to carry ra-
tions of any kind. This soldier reported for transportation
June 28, 1900.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

5. Upon the recommendation of the Chief Surgeon of the
Division, Corporal Alexander Vought, troop H, 2d Cavalry,
now in the hospital at Santa Clara Barracks, Cuba, is trans-
ferred to the hospital at Cabaña Barracks, Cuba, for further
observation and treatment, and to which point he will be
sent by the commanding officer, Santa Clara Barracks,
Cuba.

The Quartermaster's Department will furnish the neces-
sary transportation.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

6. Captain Edward B. Ives, Signal Officer, U. S. Volun-
teers, will proceed to Matanzas, Cuba, and carry out the
instructions of the Chief Signal Officer of the Division, and
upon completion of the duty assigned him will return to
his proper station, Havana, Cuba.
The travel enjoined is necessary for the public service.

7. Leave of absence for two (2) months on surgeon's
certificate of disability, with permission to leave the limits
of the Division, is hereby granted to Captain Henry H.
Benham, 2d Infantry.
BY COMMAND OF MAJOR GENERAL WOOD:

W. V. Richards
Adjutant General.
